Reviews.Title: A good point & shoot
Reviews.Author: J. Maitland "Austin"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a overall nice little camera to have.  If I could, I would give it 3 1/2 stars.  It has nice features like 14 mega pixels (which isn't necessarily better) and a really nice 3 inch screen.  It is lacking any good manual settings, so if you're into having those this wouldn't be a good camera for you.  It does take HD video which is nice.  I definitely wasn't blown away with image quality either.  Sometimes I will get an amazing picture with beautiful colors, and other times most of the pics I will get are blurry.  I have noticed that this camera is really bad at capturing a crisp image in overcast outdoor lighting.  Overall this is best for the person who wants a casual camera for taking nice pictures of family events and people.  Especially because it has a cool feature called face RECOGNIZATION in addition to face detection.  The recognization part comes in when you can tag someones face in a pic, and it will recognize that same face in other pics and put all pics of that same person into their own folder on the camera.  Good for social events.

Reviews.Title: At last a camera with micro USB charging
Reviews.Author: Dinopepsia
Reviews.Content: This camera charges through a single standard micro usb connector. When you connect the camera to your computer it charges as you transfer your pictures. No need for a separate plug-in charger or another proprietary cable while travelling. I am unaware of any other camera that has this feature.

Reviews.Title: Best shot for your buck
Reviews.Author: Fadil H. Khan
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! Incredible photographs..near, far, dark or bright scenes it does not matter you still get great pictures. The colors in the pictures are brilliant and true. One great feature of this camera is its ability to take pictures is quick successions, there is very little wait time between shots...id say 1 sec compared to some sony and cannon cameras that ive researched which are like 3-4 secs.The HD video recording is smooth and beautiful. Night shots are clear and smooth with the lightening bright flash. 14MP well its 14MP I don't need to say more about that.The battery life could be a bit better and the onscreen menu is a bit tricky to navigate but its a small price to pay for the overall great performance of this camera!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera, great value
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new camera to replace an older Fuji model that I was using a rubberband on to hold the battery door closed. I choose the Kodak M575 for a couple of reasons first it had all the features in fact most of them I haven't even tried yet but they're there when I want them and the price I paid was excellent, under a $100 dollars. Since getting the camera I have been doing some experimenting and there is a learning curve with any new device but for the most part this Kodak is simple to use and produces good results. Even the video is passable given that was not why I bought the camera I was pleasently surprised by the quality. The camera was discounted because it was the black model so unless you can't live without a purple camera save yourself a few bucks the picture quality is the same.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Kodak Kamera
Reviews.Author: G. Max Gooding
Reviews.Content: Introduction:Previously to getting this camera, I had some Sony cameras that ended up giving me some trouble, so I decided to make a brand switch. Kodak has been in the photography business for years and is a well trusted name. In fact the trade name Kodak was registered in the year 1888. Subsequently, the Eastman Kodak company was registed in 1892. Why is this so important? When buying a camera, reliability is important, especially if you travel to distant locations where you may want to capture a once in a lifetime experiences on your camera. The last thing you want is for your camera to konk out on you when you most need it.The M575:This is a feature rich camera, and has all that you need to capture and share your pictures easily and effortlessly. I have found these cameras to be defect free and to perform as per specifications. What I found to be unique about this camera is that you can tag your pictures so that you can find your subjects easily.Here are a few notes that may help you in your purchasing decision:- No software is included, you will need to download it yourself, the web site is given inside the manual.- The Camera has 5X optical zoom, but no digital zoom, which is really OK, since you can digitally zoom your pictures if you really want to on your computer.- Also in the manual is a web address that gives a lot of information, topics covered include: battery management, lens maintenance, minor repairs and firmware upgrades.The place where I purchased my Camera, I also found in the package the following:- a Kodak Camera Case- a 2GB SD Kingston Memory CardSo, I recommend that you check what you actually get in the box before buying additional memory, or a camera case.This product works properly and it is well supported, so that if you run into problems there is abundant support so that you can make the most of your camera investment. And remember, smile, it's Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Great quailty
Reviews.Author: Ken staten
Reviews.Content: Took this to my family reunion on the 3-4 of July.Everyone was amazed at the picture quality.Had more people use my camera than there own,14 MP makes a big difference.

Reviews.Title: Great point & shoot
Reviews.Author: M. Allen
Reviews.Content: I am no photographer... I am all about just snapping pics whenever and however I can. I am not one for a fancy camera that will take me 1 month to figure out. I've gotten a lot of compliments on the quality of the pictures that have come from this camera. Someone even asked if I used a Rebel! It's easy to operate, has a ton of settings, and it takes great pictures. If you just want a "family" camera to take pictures of the kids now and then and interesting places you visit, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: great camera...
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: The kodak name is already an established well known camera. I have got so many complimnets on how professional the pictures look. the service also was speedy, I had no trouble with anything. I will defentely recommend this camera and seller to anyone..

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Bill Seward
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that this camera is easy to use and takes decent pictures, I'm very disappointed in the feature set.  It was purchased to replace a Kodak C875 that may go down as the best point-and-shoot I ever own.  For what it was, it offered a ton of options to control your photos, and I expected more of the same from this one.  Well, it isn't in there.  If you want a camera that you can leave on auto and just snap, snap, snap, this is a good choice.  Take it out of auto and you're going to get very frustrated very quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Revels "Nick"
Reviews.Content: I had bought a Polaroid on Black Friday, but it turned out to be a piece of junk. This camera is awesome. The color is amazing, the 14mp gives you unbelievable size, and its fairly easy to use. The panoramic setting is very well done and fun to use. I would highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: terrible camera
Reviews.Author: JoAnn
Reviews.Content: My camera, a Canon Powershot A 610 (which I loved) was stolen, so I needed a new camera right away. I usually do alot of research on a product before I purchase it, but I did not have the time to do that with this camera. The pictures usually come out blurry, the low light level is terrible and it takes along time between pictures. So, if you want to get alot of photos of something quick, forget about it. The absolute worst thing is unless you are taking a still photo, like landscape, chances are you will not get the picture that you thought you took. When you push the button to take a photo, it seems to take 4 seconds before the actual picture is taken. I can't tell you how many times I have taken a picture of something, and I didn't get it because the speed of the camera is so slow.  I get a picture of something that happened 4 seconds after the picture I wanted. It was my grandson's first birthday and most of the pictures are blurry. I missed alot of the funny faces and expressions he made because the camera takes so long to take a picture. I'm so disappointed. Another thing I noticed, is the few pictures I have printed with this camera came out darker and with much less definition than my old camera. I also miss not having a view finder, but I knew that when I bought it. The camera stinks, so don't buy it. I am getting another Canon this week.

Reviews.Title: Not Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: iRA
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is good. However, it takes too long before the picture is taken. You cannot take action shots, because the action has come and gone before the shot is finally taken.

Reviews.Title: Bullet-proof camera
Reviews.Author: Dan P. Bullard
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my wife, who wasn't very impressed with the picture quality, so I took it. It shoots nice pictures, sometimes it gets the focus wrong, but I like shooting HD video with it too. Living on a houseboat on the Columbia River we are constantly taking pictures, and constantly dropping things (tools, cell phones, etc) in the river. Twice I dropped this camera in the water, once in 3 inches of water (no effect at all!) and later I dropped it in 5 feet of water. After 5 minutes of trying to retrieve it with a magnet I was able to hook the wrist strap and pulled it up. After two weeks of drying it's back to 100% operational, no lasting effects at all! Try that with any other camera on the market in this price range! This baby has earned a permanent place in my pocket!To see photos from this camera go to [...]

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Rae Atkinson
Reviews.Content: This is my second EasyShare camera, the first one being bought in 2005. This camera sport 14 megapixels and a 3 inch screen, so you can really see your pics well. IT takes great pics dark or light. The Flash on it is intense! This camera has a button that lets you select certain photos for Facebook so the next time you connect your photos it automatically syncs them to Facebook so you don't have to manually upload photos anymore. Which is a quick, handy little tool. If you want a midpriced camera with great quality, its a simple one to make, Kodak EasyShare.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: wvulery
Reviews.Content: This is the third one of these cameras I have purchased.  i bought one for each of my kids for Christmas and they liked them so much I bought one for my self.  It is very easy to use and offers a wide range of automatic settings.

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera!
Reviews.Author: I M "TheRealMcCoy"
Reviews.Content: So far I like everything about the camera. I thought the easy share was going to work of blue tooth or wifi technology but you have to plug in to your laptop to make it work. Also the charger plugs to the camera instead of charging the battery. So you can't use your camera if you need to charge the battery. You would have to buy a charger that charges the battery. Other than that the camera so far works well and is very easy to use! I like the 5X Zoom!

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: no_pen_name
Reviews.Content: I like this camera and the price at Amazon was great. It has many Pro's, and the few Con's are: (1) You have to push a few buttons before you start to record a movie. I previously had a Casio Exilim Card camera and all it took was the push of a single button and the movie recording would start, which I really liked.  We have a small child and you have to be quick or the moment is gone. (2) I am not into social networks and the whole share button function is somewhat overrated and annoying to me, but the red button is also easy to ignore. (3) You have to download Kodak software to get your images transferred to the PC and I would prefer it if the camera would just appear as an external USB drive. (4) The USB cable port is covered with a flimsy rubber cap and it will probably rip off some day.But like I said, all in all the camera works well, it's easy to use, feels good and solid, takes great photos and great HD videos, and the shutter lag is minimal which I really like a lot. The 5x Zoom is also nice and the LCD screen is quite large.  I would recommend this to anybody who's looking for a cheap, easy and capable point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: Kyle Aspe
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera I have ever owned, the first one I bought had to be sent back to the seller because it was immediately defective, making buzzing and clicking noises whenever it zoomed in and out. The second camera is only a few months old, hardly used, and the battery life is poor, the camera refuses to stay on, even when fully charged, I feel like the power button never works and is unpredictable when it will actually 'listen' and turn off or on, sometimes when the camera turns off the zoom lens will remain out, so storing it is not an option.Save your money, buy a better camera, its not work spending under 100$ on something like this that lasts a whole month.

Reviews.Title: A Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: P. Swafford
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a replacement for my Kodak V550, which is by far the best digital camera I've ever used. I attributed the quality of the pictures in the V550 to the Schneider-Kreuznach lens. When I saw that the M575 had a Schneider-Kreuznach lens with optical zoom, I was optimistic that I had found a replacement for the discontinued V550. I've used the camera now under a number of different conditions and have not seen the picture clarity I was hoping for. First, it is difficult to get the camera to take a distance shot under low light conditions. I kept ending up with blurry shots because the autofocus kept defaulting to close-up. But even when I got the focus settings to match what I was photographing, the picture clarity was pretty poor. Contributing to this is the poor design of the camera buttons. They're not easy to distinguish by touch, making it hard to get take even the mediocre shots the camera produces. I don't think the Kodak company has much of a future if they keep producing failures like this.

Reviews.Title: Poor construction
Reviews.Author: Michael Wood
Reviews.Content: Camera takes good pictures, but after opening the battery and SD card door a few times it doesn't want to stay shut.  I had to use a small piece of electric tape to hold it together.

Reviews.Title: pretty good
Reviews.Author: Donald
Reviews.Content: it was for the girlfreind. read intructions to get used to it. takes good pictures. gotta get used to know when not to use flash.

Reviews.Title: Muy bien
Reviews.Author: Endy
Reviews.Content: Excelente camara aunque ahora hay de masmega pixels, en cuanto a la entrega todo a tiempo y en optimas condiciones el producto.... saludos desde Venezuela

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: CristinaT
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera and from what I've seen so far, it takes great pictures. The only thing I don't like is that the screen is a little more scratched than I thought it would be (I got mine used) and the lens make a really annoying whirring sound every time they go in or out.

Reviews.Title: Very Sensitive
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for a year and really only used it once. Then I dropped it from about five feet on carpet and it broke. It was a lens error. Mine wasn't able to be fixed and now its useless. Nice while it lasted, but it lasted as long as Kim Kardashian's marriage.Sincerely ticked,Nathaniel

Reviews.Title: Excelente hasta que la conectas al PC. Excellent until Connected to PC
Reviews.Author: Jesus Barrios "jabarriosb"
Reviews.Content: La relación precio-valor es excelente, imágenes muy claras, al igual que los vídeos, claro, no es una cámara profesional o semi-profesional, pero es muy buena. Muchas opciones pre-establecidas para tomar fotografías de alta calidad sin ser expertos. Un gran zoom y estabilidad incluso para personas que tiemblan demasiado.The price-value relationship is excellent, very clear images, like videos, of course, not a camera professional or semi-professional, but very good. Many pre-set options for taking high quality photos without being experts. A large zoom and stability even for people who tremble too.

Reviews.Title: try something else
Reviews.Author: Gigi
Reviews.Content: Not happy at all with this camera.  Poor picture quality and not user friendly. Constant problems with the flash not working properly.  My daughter has a different type of Kodak and I thought there would be consistency in their products, but was sorely disappointed. Decided to pass it on to my kids and get something else and after using it a few times, they gave it back!

Reviews.Title: used the camera once and it blew up!
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take on a vacation, I wanted a smaller camera than what I had, and after owning 3 other Kodak cameras I choose this.  The size was great and the first set of photos were great too, but the first night of our vacation I plugged this into the electric outlet to charge and it basically blew up, big spark!  No more camera! I was lucky that other people on my vacation could download there photos onto my laptop. So I had to mail it in to Kodak to be fixed, even with the warranty, I still had to pay $10.00 to ship it to the and then $27.00 to get it repaired!  That is right repaired not replaced.

Reviews.Title: Kodam camers
Reviews.Author: Carolyn J. Miller "millerqueen"
Reviews.Content: I like my Kodak Easyshare digital camera with 5x wide angle..optical zoom and 3 inch LCD .  It works just fine for me.

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: pedro flores
Reviews.Content: widely recommend this product, excellent quality, durable, comes complete with everything close at a great price for good qualityvery complete, I recommend this product works perfectly for goodquality

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: pickyconsumer
Reviews.Content: trying to get used to the new features and how it operates compared to my older camera. Just a learning curve you get on anything. great pics!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: William Gorrell
Reviews.Content: Good camera. great pic quality. good zoom. sometimes a little rough using it on the fly when trying to change functions and options. but overall a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Say Cheese!!
Reviews.Author: Susan "Bubbasu"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a Kodak V1003, which had served me well for about 2.5 years and then all of a sudden the shutter quit and would not open.I love this little camera!! It is compact,fits in one's pocket nicely and has a  large screen so you get a good  view at what you are photographing. The "buttons" on top could be a little bigger and raised up a little to make it easier to operate.  The price was great too. I am no professional but I do love to capture "those moments" and I can do this easily with this camera.  I love how it does the focusing for me, adjusting for light condition,distance etc.What I do not like is the "new" way  photos are trasferred to my computer, I have to go through more steps now than  with the old camera. I wish they would leave well enough alone!!I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: USB charging
Reviews.Author: bobs
Reviews.Content: I like the camera, but the one thing I don't like is that you have to plug it in to a wall outlet in order to charge the unit. I would think that the unit would charge like the other Kodak Cameras that I have through the USB port.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: L. Duffey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my high school aged daugther. She loves it. It is easy to use, and takes great photos. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: just right
Reviews.Author: Delores A.Williams
Reviews.Content: This is a purchase for traveling.  Size is great and is light. The menus are not as easy to navigate as I hoped but I'm learning.  Pics are really good.  I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Quick & Easy
Reviews.Author: Mi6300m
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month now. My kids and I love it. It responds pretty quick the settings weren't complicated at all. Video Quality was superb. Although I did notice a couple of dead pixels while recording...it's not that noticable when watching on TV.This camera is a definite BUY!

Reviews.Title: Amazing surprise!
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my wife before we went to Disney World. I didn't expect a whole lot from a Kodak camera but I was completely wrong! Setup took just a couple minutes and (once I read the book) the Easyshare has been a huge time saver. The image quality has been great both online and in print. All in all it is a very simple  camera to use that we love. And for the value, this camera is very tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: It's Me Grandma "OMA"
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for my daughter-in-law as a Christmas present.  She has taken hundreds of pictures since getting this camera.  It is easy to operate and takes awesome pictures. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak over Nikon
Reviews.Author: K. Christensen "Average Dad"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace a Nikon S4000(Nikon Coolpix S4000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch Touch-Panel LCD (Silver)) that we've only had for a few months. The camera was a nightmare. The Nikon replaced an older Kodak EasyShare and it was a great camera for a great price and this new Kodak has lived up to its predecessor.  Bottom line, we paid the price by going with something other than an EasyShare. Kodak makes a great camera and we probably won't buy any other camera again.  We always give out custom family calendars to our parents as Christmas gifts and the low quality images from cameras of our brothers and sisters always seem to "ruin" our good calendar picture sets. This camera has never failed us and works seamlessly with both our Mac and PC. Great camera.  iPHOTO users!! Just a happy little note about this one, when you import these to iPhoto (and other photo software setups as well), the camera AUTOMATICALLY rotates and orients portrait and landscape photos correctly. There is no need to rotate pics that were taken with the camera sideways... This may seem insignificant but our Nikon didn't do this and it was a headache. My wife takes close to 50 pics every few days and it was a HUGE inconvenience to go through and manually rotate all the "portrait" oriented photos.  Very Happy with the purchase. Updates to follow...

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: jason voorhees
Reviews.Content: Camera is great for the price,Takes great pics, I paid about $100 for this camera with 4gig memory card and case.I looked around a lot and this is the best deal around,You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, good price
Reviews.Author: G. Yang
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was impressed that there were so many language options on this camera. I was also impressed by the ease of use, point and shoot at it's greatest. The camera works very well, I have used it quite a few times since I bought it. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: Just right.
Reviews.Author: Swee P
Reviews.Content: I am a bit of a techno laggard... This camera is amazing!  Great price, arrived quickly, painless set and no bugs. It is exactly what it says. I put off purchasing waiting for price and technology-wow!  Photo shopping old pictures is awesome-dude!  More than suits my needs. Only annoyance might be camera jack is small and can take glasses and light to accomplish.  Now what to do with a drawer full of errant 35mm cameras...

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: Juan
Reviews.Content: El producto es muy bueno, cumple con mis espectativas, la calidad de imagen es buena, el zoom, facil de usar, y el precio esta muy bien.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mjacks
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my boyfriend and we've been pretty happy with the quality of pictures. The only thing we've found was that the camera takes a while to zoom and then it doesn't re-focus properly right away. Overall, it was a very good purchase and we're really happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Haley Riney
Reviews.Content: I don't know why kodak is not more highly reccommended. It was a gift for my mom and I like it just as much as my cannon powershot that was more than twice the price! Very good buy!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Vite
Reviews.Content: Pros: 14mp, tag people feature, easy point and shoot, Hd 720p video, Rechargeable battery, charge on the pcCons: No night mode, no flash on video recording

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: F. Wilds "Boondocks Fan"
Reviews.Content: Got this after the battery door on my older Kodak broke.  I love it.  Every picture has turned out great - so clear and bright.  It has so many different "scenes" to choose from.  I can take a pic in a totally dark room and it looks like all of the lights were on.  The optical zoom is great (5X) - that's hard to find in a small, affordable camera.

Reviews.Title: Stay away from this prodect
Reviews.Author: carnirel
Reviews.Content: I was warned not to purchase a camera with a special battery, but it was a gift, so I thought maybe it won't be too bad..Barely 6 months later, the battery started to go and when I contacted the company, they made suggestions like don't use the flash and keep it out of the cold..This camera was moderately used, the battery shouldn't be going bad already and I am not spending 30 plus dollars to replace it..I rather go back to rechargeable AA batteries that my previous camera had, it last for years....

Reviews.Title: Pretty disappointed
Reviews.Author: kg
Reviews.Content: I am pretty disappointed in this camera overall.  It took me a while to begin taking pictures with it, which ruined my chances of returning the item, as I would have, had I known how horrible the pics would turn out.Each time I have used it, 80% of the pictures came out grainy and blurry.  I have tried different settings but cannot find one that makes much of a difference.The worst part is the fact that it defaults to Smart Capture when you turn it off/on.  So even if I were to find a setting I liked, I would have to reset it each time I turn the camera back on.So sad that it is only my second digital camera, and the first one took FAR better pictures (Sony), and was cheaper as well.I guess I will stick with Sony or another brand.  Problem is I went by the reviews on this site, and it actually gets pretty good ones.  So much for that.  I would try to sell it on Ebay, but wouldn't want to do that to someone else.  Bummed. :(

Reviews.Title: I would buy it again.
Reviews.Author: cdmotel
Reviews.Content: Good camera for general everyday picture taking.Image quality very good,easy to use,menu easy to navigate.Also includes sharing software for most social networking sites.Good camera would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: Arthur A. Northrop
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this camera so far, Have used it a few times with good results

Reviews.Title: it's pretty nice
Reviews.Author: juju
Reviews.Content: Operating buttons are extremely small and hard to use.  Wanted 10x zoom could not find one, so had to settle for 5x, hope the 14 mega pixels make images sharp enough to enlarge.  Wanted a pocket size camera for vacation and hiking in Yellowstone this spring this better fit the bill, or I will be pissed.  Sound like expect a lot -think I paid $96-I work hard for my money and i do expect a lot for it. It also makes an awful lot of noise when the lens extends as you turn it on-I hope it holds up.

ProductInfo.Features:
14-megapixel resolution for stunning prints up to 30 x 40 inches
5x optical zoom; 28 mm wide-angle lens
3-inch LCD with KODAK Color Science Technology
Kodak's Smart Capture feature
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M575 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Midnight Black)
